channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sweet news: Hershey announces new treats for the 2025 holiday season
item.description: Now that Halloween has come and gone, you might have wrongly assumed that candy season is over. Not if the Hershey Co. has anything to say about it. I...

item.title: AI reasoning models that can ‘think’ are more vulnerable to jailbreak attacks, new research suggests
item.description: A new study suggests that the advanced reasoning powering today’s AI models can weaken their safety systems.

item.title: Nvidia Stock Is Having a Great Year, but This Tech Dinosaur Is Still Beating It
item.description: The tech company has outperformed nearly all of the Magnificent Seven stocks this year.

item.title: Some desperate travelers turn to U-Haul as the government shutdown cuts flights and sends car rentals soaring
item.description: Meanwhile, Amtrak expects more bookings, and bus services are preparing for more demand.

item.title: How Performance Management Systems Fail Employees
item.description: It’s time to stop managing imaginary employees and start engineering real human performance.

item.title: Spirit Christmas is back with 30 pop-up stores: Full list of locations for your holiday shopping needs
item.description: With Black Friday just three weeks away, retailers and shoppers have one thing on their mind—Christmas, the busiest and most profitable time of the ye...

item.title: After more than 200 years, the ‘Farmers’ Almanac’ is shutting down for good
item.description: Since 1818, loyal readers of the Farmers’ Almanac have turned to the publication for weather predictions, gardening tips, astronomy calendars, and mor...

item.title: Trump asks Justice Department to probe meatpackers on prices
item.description: Trump’s decision to impose a 50% tariffs on products from Brazil over diplomatic disputes also affected their beef exports.

item.title: Tech’s worst week since April shows the AI boom may be breaking
item.description: Technology stocks fell on November 7 amid fears of an AI bubble, a further-drawn-out federal government shutdown, and economic data that suggests cons...

item.title: Shay Mitchell Just Launched a Skin Care Brand for Kids. Not Everyone Is Happy
item.description: The brand debuted with five K-beauty-inspired SKUs, but has plans to expand in the future.

item.title: The Creative Economy is a Growth Driver
item.description: Cities that include the creative sector are seeing economic benefits.

item.title: Sweetgreen’s dream of being a tech company is finally dead
item.description: On November 6, Sweetgreen announced that it was selling Spyce, its division that developed and made its Infinite Kitchen technology to automate the as...

item.title: The last monkey on the loose among several that escaped after a Mississippi highway crash has been found and captured
item.description: The monkeys had been housed at the Tulane University National Biomedical Research Center in Louisiana, which routinely provides primates to scientific...

item.title: Frontier’s CEO on air travel reductions: Buy a second plane ticket from competitors if you ‘don’t want to be stranded’
item.description: "If you are flying Friday or in the next ten days and need to be there or don't want to be stranded, I highly recommend booking a backup ticket on ano...

item.title: How Artificial Intelligence Is Transforming Prospecting
item.description: AI isn’t replacing salespeople, it’s reprogramming how we find, engage, and build relationships with potential customers.
